message:
It feels maybe 50x slower than Arc/pg[1], and who knows how many hundreds of times slower than Python, but... it works! Had to tweak some stuff to make it work with the awesome changes I've been doing (curdir, srcdir, etc.) but it works.

I would now say Arc/ar is roughly comparable to Python when it comes to shell scripts. Actually, you know what? I would say that Arc/ar is now *better* than Python at shell scripts. Now all it needs is some nice juicy `import` ala Arubic and it'd be great.

* [1]: Disclaimer: I haven't done any tests, so I don't know exactly how slow it is... it could be a problem with my script, but I don't really feel like testing it. So for now I'll say that it's very (very) slow, and I don't really know the actual cause.
Hm... it actually seemed fast once I disabled the utterly insanely CPU-intensive string search algorithm. Guess I know which part to optimize!
